titles.ar: بَابُ الرَّجُلِ يُسْلِمُ فَيَحُجُّ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَخْتَتِنَ
titles.en: Chapter 43 – The man becomes a Muslim, so he performs Hajj before he is circumcised

titles.ar: بَابُ الرَّجُلِ يُسْلِمُ فَيَحُجُّ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَخْتَتِنَ
titles.en: Chapter 43 – The man becomes a Muslim, so he performs Hajj before he is circumcised

verses.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ مَيْمُونٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي الرَّجُلِ يُسْلِمُ فَيُرِيدُ أَنْ يَحُجَّ وَ قَدْ حَضَرَ الْحَجُّ أَ يَحُجُّ أَوْ يَخْتَتِنُ قَالَ لَا يَحُجُّ حَتَّى يَخْتَتِنَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Safwan, from Ibrahim Bin Maymoun, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> regarding the man who became a Muslim, so he intended to perform Hajj, and the (season) for the Hajj had presented itself, should he perform Hajj or should he be circumcised?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘He should not perform Hajj until he is circumcised’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ أَنْ تَطُوفَ الْمَرْأَةُ غَيْرَ الْمَخْفُوضَةِ فَأَمَّا الرَّجُلُ فَلَا يَطُوفُ إِلَّا وَ هُوَ مُخْتَتِنٌ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Hammad Bin Isa, from Hareyz, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There is no problem if the woman circumambulates without having been circumcised, but as for the man, so he should not circumambulate unless he is circumcised’.
